definition[0]: if one company gobbles up a smaller company, it buys it and takes control of it
example[0]: Air France gobbled up its main French rivals, Air Inter and UTA.
definition[1]: to quickly use a lot of a supply of something such as money or land
example[1]: Inflation has gobbled up our wage increases.
definition[2]: to eat something very quickly, especially in an impolite or greedy way
example[2]: We gobbled up all of the cake in one evening.
